conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to determine the frictional force acting on the wire frame at t = 2.5 seconds.
A single-turn square wire frame is placed stationary on a horizontal surface with half of it in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane.
The side length of the wire frame is 0.2m, and its total resistance is 4Ω.
The relationship between the magnitude of the magnetic induction intensity B and time t is B=(3 + 2t)T.
The effective area of the wire frame in the magnetic field is 0.02 m^2.
At t = 2.5 seconds, the magnetic field B is 8 T.
The magnetic flux at t = 2.5 seconds is 0.16 Wb.
The rate of change of the magnetic flux is 0.04 Wb/s.
The magnetic force on the wire frame is -0.016 N.
The magnitude of the frictional force is 0.016 N.

premise: The wire frame remains stationary, so frictional force balances magnetic force.
conclusion: The direction of the frictional force is to the right.

premise: The magnitude of the frictional force acting on the wire frame is 0.016 N, and the direction is to the right.
conclusion: The magnitude of the frictional force acting on the wire frame at t = 2.5 seconds is 0.016 N, and its direction is to the right.
